metadata.name: Import LDAP Data Interchange Format File Via Ldifde.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of "Ldifde.exe" with the import flag "-i". The can be abused to include HTTP-based arguments which will allow the arbitrary download of files from a remote server.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\ldifde.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('ldifde.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-i')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-f')))

output.summary: Detects the execution of "Ldifde.exe" with the import flag "-i". The can be abused to include HTTP-based arguments which will allow the arbitrary download of files from a remote server.

metadata.objective: False positive: Since the content of the files are unknown, false positives are expected References: https://twitter.com/0gtweet/status/1564968845726580736, https://strontic.github.io/xcyclopedia/library/ldifde.exe-979DE101F5059CEC1D2C56967CA2BAC0.html, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/it-pro/windows-server-2012-r2-and-2012/cc731033(v=ws.11)
